result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

(Case called at 1:50 PM)
Defendant Adam Berg appears in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Adam Berg.  District Attorney Peter Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense advises the Court that there is a DAGP offer that is being discussed, but more time is needed to finalize that - requests 30 days out.
Status Conference: December 2, 2022 at 3:15 PM

11:20 AM case called.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam E. Berg in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Adam E. Berg. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Status Conference set for 10/27/2022 at 1:45 PM

Notice of Completion of Representation
Same as Complaint

9:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam E. Berg appeared by phone.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Adam E. Berg. Defendant waives right to appear in person.

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Case referred to Br. 5 for scheduling arraignment.
Arraignment on August 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.

There is a DAGP offer from the State.

Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
